intro: Teucrium arenarium, commonly known as sand cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of southern Europe and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, often blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Teucrium arenarium is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
